SEARCH
Package com.retriage.retriage.controllers

Class PatientPoolTmpController

java.lang.Object
com.retriage.retriage.controllers.PatientPoolTmpController
@RestController @CrossOrigin @RequestMapping("/api/pools/templates") public class PatientPoolTmpController extends Object
REST controller for managing PatientPoolTmp resources. Provides API endpoints for creating, retrieving, and deleting patient pool templates. Handles cross-origin requests via CrossOrigin.

  • Constructor Details

    • PatientPoolTmpController

      public PatientPoolTmpController(PatientPoolTmpService poolService)
      Constructs an instance of PatientPoolTmpController.
      Parameters:
      poolService - The service for managing patient pool templates.

  • Method Details

    • createPool

      @PostMapping(consumes="application/json", produces="application/json") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'Director\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> createPool(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid PatientPoolTmpForm poolForm)
      Create a new PatientPool template. Handles POST requests to /api/pools/templates. Validates the input form and saves the new patient pool template. Only accessible to users with the 'Director' role.
      Parameters:
      poolForm - The form containing the data for the new patient pool template.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity indicating the result of the creation. Returns HTTP 201 (Created) with the created PatientPoolTmp on success, or HTTP 500 (Internal Server Error) with an ErrorResponse if saving fails.

    • getAllPools

      @GetMapping(produces="application/json") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'Director\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<PatientPoolTmp>> getAllPools()
      Get all Patient Pool templates. Handles GET requests to /api/pools/templates. Retrieves and returns a list of all existing patient pool templates. Only accessible to users with the 'Director' role.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of all PatientPoolTmp objects, or an empty list if none exist, with HTTP 200 (OK).

    • deletePool

      @DeleteMapping(value="/{id}", produces="application/json") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'Director\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deletePool(@PathVariable Long id)
      Delete a Patient Pool template by its ID. Handles DELETE requests to /api/pools/templates/{id}. Only accessible to users with the 'Director' role.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the patient pool template to delete.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity indicating the result of the deletion. Returns HTTP 200 (OK) on successful deletion, HTTP 404 (Not Found) if the template does not exist, or HTTP 500 (Internal Server Error) if deletion fails after finding the template.
